column3: Intelligent Plant Watering System: Smart city
column4: P. Kusuma, S. Rajashree, M. L. Chayadevi, Mona, K. S. Shreedevi and S. Geetha
column6: �In the present situation, human beings are very busy in their daily routine, making them not have enough time to take care of the plants. By making use of advanced technology such as the Internet of Things (IoT) one can design a system that can be used to monitor and update the progress of plant growth and provide plants with the required amount of water by helping the owner in taking care of plants even in their absentia. This paper presents a system for watering plants that considers weather conditions as one of the main parameters that can be taken from Google Weather and present conditions of the plant from the sensor. The system makes use of three sensors namely temperature, humidity, and soil moisture. Both data from Google and sensors are analyzed using an ML model to predict whether to water the plant and how much water should be given to the plant at the scheduled time

column3: Deep learning for cloud storage security: A systematic review
column4: Latha S S, M. L.  Chayadevi, Deepu Raju
column6: Cloud service companies are becoming among the most famous worldwide. Cloud computing poses security risks. This has worried industry and academia. Because it is dynamic, the security computing environment is subject to multiple DDoS attacks and data privacy breaches. Common security vulnerabilities like DDoS assaults affect cloud services. This can make services unavailable. Cloud Service Providers can provide high-quality services to cloud users by limiting DDoS attacks. Many methods and tools are developed to detect and mitigate DDoS attacks. Many approaches cannot detect efficiently with few false signals. Deep learning (DL) algorithms can classify normal and attacked data in certain instances.

column3: Vehicular Networks: Revolutionizing Motor Vehicle Operations and Governance through Blockchain
column4: Geetha, S., Ashna, P.S., Bhat, A., Singh, H.P.
column6: This research presents a pioneering approach to tackle the rising issue of scams plaguing the automotive industry, focusing particularly on the vulnerabilities associated with Vehicle Identification Numbers (VINs). By leveraging advanced steganographic techniques for encryption and the robustness of blockchain technology, this study offers a comprehensive solution aimed at enhancing security, transparency, and countering fraud within the automotive ecosystem. The proposed methodology entails embedding steganographic images onto various parts of vehicles, bolstering authentication mechanisms and enabling efficient tracking of vehicle histories, crucial for used car transactions. Moreover, the incorporation of blockchain, specifically Hyperledger Fabric, into the automotive supply chain management ensures a secure, reliable, tamper-proof, and transparent framework, thereby mitigating the risks posed by fraudulent activities. The study aims to revolutionize existing industry systems, uphold safety measures, and instill confidence among consumers and stakeholders, ultimately fostering a resilient and secure automotive environment.

column3: Investigation and Monitoring Deforestation by Evaluating the Satellite Images and Machine Learning
column4: Ashwini R Malipatil,  Pallavi C V,  Jayashree, Geetha L S
column6: A woodland can be restored by planting new trees, caring for existing ones, and conserving natural resources. The effects of climate change could be mitigated with the help of new financing for woodland rehabilitation initiatives around the globe. Current poll methods for rehabilitation, while useful, could be improved so that such vast efforts can be tracked more effectively. Using satellite data, a machine-learning algorithm was developed to monitor the trees and plants in the forest area. The purpose of this paper is to investigate the viability of monitoring replanting initiatives using machine learning and high-resolution satellite images. The purpose of this research is to create an innovative but challenging collection using high-resolution satellite images. We discuss the training and testing of a random forest machine learning model on this one-of-a-kind dataset, which was collected from a location in northern Fiji where a native forest was being restored. Testing the proposed RF-Ranger model on a dataset, it was found to be highly accurate, with a categorization accuracy of 97.5% and a Macro-F1 score of 97.4% on unobserved pixels. Conservation International (CI), a nonprofit environmental group studied in cooperation for this study, may oversee the current replanting location assessed here. The proposed model, RF-Ranger, was able to correctly recognize plants in forest regeneration areas and therefore has the potential to be used for large-scale monitoring of such efforts.

column3: Text Detection from Image and Video Frames using Improved Golden Jackal Optimization based Shallow Convolutional Neural Network
column4: Chitra M, M. J. Roopa, M. K. Prakruthi, M. L. Chayadevi, M. Rajani Shree, M. D. Swetha
column6: Text Detection from Image and Video Frames Using Improved Golden Jackal Optimization based Shallow Convolutional Neural Network Text detection plays a significant role in reading the text content worldwide and it is difficult to localize due to the natural scene image texts being distributed. The lower resolution, text orientation, size, and writing style variations make text detection a challenging process. To overcome the above-defined problems, this article proposed a Cosine Similarity-Golden Jackal Optimization (CSGJO) based Shallow Convolutional Neural Network (CNN). The datasets utilized for estimating the proposed method are ICDAR2015, MSRA-TD500, and CTW1500 datasets. The data augmentation and normalization are utilized as preprocessing techniques which enhances the dataset size and removes null values. The pre-processed images are given to the feature extraction process using SE-ResNet152 which extracts the relevant features from the input. The extracted features are given to CSGJO which can consider the correlation among various features. After selecting the features, the shallow CNN is employed for detecting the text from input and video frames. The precision, recall, and f-measure are considered as metrics for assessing model performance. The CSGJO-based shallow CNN attained high precision of 92.57%, 93.69%, and 89.46% for ICDAR2015, MSRA-TD500 and CTW1500 datasets respectively. The proposed model performed better when compared to existing methods like Multi-Headed Self-Attention (MHSA), Graph Convolutional Networks (GCN), and Decoupled Feature Pyramid Networks (DFPN). Keywords: Data augmentation, Golden jackal optimization, Multi-headed self-attention, Convolutional neural network, Text detection

column3: Sign Language Conversion to Speech with the Application of KNN Algorithm
column6: Sign language is mainly used by those who are unable to speak, to communicate. The vast majority of people are not able to understand the Universal Sign Language (unless they have learned it) and due to this lack of knowledge about the language, they have difficulty communicating with mute people. This paper focuses on developing an application that bridges the gap between mute people and the rest of society. It captures gestures made by a person using American sign language (ASL), and converts them into corresponding text and speech in real time. The proposed study will acquire translations of sign language gestures in text, which will be later transformed into audio. In this way, a sign language translator will be developed. Further, Convolutional neural networks (CNNs) are utilized for the detection of different gestures. CNNs are highly effective for solving computer vision problems and can detect the desired features with high degrees of accuracy upon exercising sufficient training. K-NN classification is used to recognize sign language.

column3: Printed Power Module with Advanced Thermal Management
column4: Sai Avuthu, Yash Singh,�Rajen Modi,�Rohit Baranwal,�Nilay Mehta
column6: This study presents the development of high-performance power modules with advanced 3D printed ceramics, integrated cooling channels and Cu pinfins for thermal management. Thick film printed electronics was employed for circuit metallization. SiC dies were then attached using Sinter Silver process for improved thermal performance and reliability. Thermal and electrical testing was performed to demonstrate the module�s capability.

column3: A Study on Teaching Reform Based on the Management Information System of Organic Chemistry Course
column6: The course Organic Chemistry is an important foundation course in the subject of chemistry. However, the Organic Chemistry course has problems such as the lack of integration of ideological and political education into the classroom, the inadequate feedback system after the class and the absence of a more effective information-based teaching mode suitable for the study of Organic Chemistry. Based on this situation, this paper applies computer application technology to the teaching mode of the Organic Chemistry course and designs and develops the Organic Chemistry course management information system. The system aims to improve students' course learning efficiency, develop a strong sense of national honour, enhance teachers' classroom teaching effectiveness and promote the development of information technology for course teaching in higher education institutions
